Combobox inputs allow users to enter information, the selections will not replace the
placeholder text by default. For best usability, build in other ways to show users the
selections they have made without opening the menu, like showing their choices with
labels or dismissible Pills in proximity to the Combobox.

Filtering vs. Search
Filtering takes an existing full list and removes items based on whether they match or
do not match specific criteria. Search starts with a blank slate and adds results based
on whether they match or do not match specific criteria.
A good rule of thumb is to use Combobox for small data sets (approximately 20-30
items), where users can quickly scan the options, and Search for large data sets or data
bases (with hundreds or thousands of entries), where manual scrolling is impractical.

Keyboard interaction
Key Description
Down Arrow « If the Listbox is available, focus is moved into the Listbox.
+ If the autocomplete behaviour automatically selected a suggestion before the Down Arrow key was pressed,
focus is placed on the suggestion following the automatically selected suggestion.
+ Otherwise, focus is placed on the first focusable element in the Listbox.
Up Arrow « If the Listbox is available, focus is placed on the last focusable element in the Listbox.
Escape « If the Listbox is visible, it dismisses the Listbox.
Enter / Space + Toggles the opened state of the Listbox.
« If the Listbox is open, selects the current highlighted Menu item.
* Space is not working for selection in Combobox with filtering.
Alt + Down Arrow + Opens Listbox when it is closed.
Alt + Up Arrow + If the Listbox has a highlighted item, selects the highlighted Menu item.
+ Closes the Listbox.
PageUp + If the Listbox is open, moves highlighting of Menu item 10 items back
PageDown + If the Listbox is open, moves highlighting of Menu item 10 steps forward.
Home * Moves highlighting to the first Menu item.
End * Moves highlighting to the last Menu item.
Alphanumeric letters + If the Combobox is filterable, typed characters act as a filter for Menu items in the Listbox.
+ If the Combobox is not filterable, highlights the current Menu item that begins with the typed characters.
+ If multiple keys are typed within 800ms, visual focus moves to the first option that matches the full string.
+ If the same character is typed in succession, visual focus cycles among the options starting with that
character.
